The ability to provide access to both staff members and anonymous users is not a benefit of model-driven apps.

questions.question_text:
You create a canvas app that uses a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet as a data source.

The spreadsheet contains a list of pets. Each column in the spreadsheet is a different attribute about a pet.

You need to create an interface to allow users to save a new pet record to the spreadsheet.

What is the minimum number of controls you need to implement to create the interface?

choices.A: One control: an edit form control
choices.C: Three controls: a text input control, a date picker control, and a combo box control
choices.B: Two controls: an edit form control and a button control
choices.D: Four controls: a text input control, a date picker control, a combo box control, and a button control

discussion.content:
B. Two controls: an edit form control and a button control.

Options C and D suggest using additional controls like text input, date picker, and combo box controls, which are not necessary to create the interface for adding a new record to the spreadsheet.

Selected Answer: B
Edit Form Control: This control is used to create a form for data entry. It automatically generates fields based on the columns in your data source (in this case, the Excel spreadsheet). This reduces the need for individual controls for each attribute.

Button Control: You need a button control to trigger the action of saving the new pet record. When the user clicks the button, you can use the OnSelect property to submit the form data to the Excel spreadsheet.

discussion.content:
B. Edit/Create

D. Details

The Edit/Create screen allows users to add new records or edit existing records in the data source.

The Browse screen displays a list of records in the data source and allows users to filter and sort the records.

The Details screen displays the details of a specific record in the data source.
B, C and D

Selected Answer: BCD

Details Screen (D. details): This screen provides detailed information about a selected record. Users often navigate to this screen by selecting a record from the Browse Screen.

Edit/Create Screen (B. edit/create): This screen allows users to edit existing records or create new ones. It provides input fields and controls for users to modify or add data.

Main: (Main User Interface) These forms provide the main user interface for viewing and interacting with table data. 

Quick Create: (Rapid Data Entry) For updated tables, these forms provide a basic form optimized for creating new records. 

Quick View: (to see related data) For updated tables, these forms appear within the main form to display additional data for a row that is referenced by a lookup column in the form. Users can view data from related tables without having to leave the form.

Card: (A compact View) Card forms are designed to present information in a compact format that is suitable for mobile devices.
